Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
CAN: The student can draw two figures representing two students, but without clear purpose or interaction.
The student might attempt to draw a string-like line connecting the students but without understanding its role.
CANNOT: The student is unable to represent a way for people to communicate over long distances using the string telephone (e.g., string drawn but doesn't connect to students' ears or mouths).
The student cannot illustrate how the device uses sound to send information from one student to another (e.g., no directionality of sound waves shown or misunderstood sound travel in air).
The student cannot correctly use the provided materials to demonstrate the construction of the string telephone (e.g., no cups shown at ends of the string or cups not used in drawing).
The student fails to show that the device includes features necessary for sending and receiving messages over a distance (e.g., cups might be drawn but not connected to string).
The student cannot depict how such communication devices are important for helping people connect over distances (e.g., no representation of communication intention or devices seen as toys).
